text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with the tuna melts that's right
this video is dedicated to all those

never ever mix fish and cheese together
and yet there they are at the diner
after coming out of the bars 2:00 in the

eat tuna melts and the reason they do is
because they're delicious so it is okay
to mix fish and cheese sometimes and
this is one of those times so check it

oil packed high quality tuna alright you
can see it's not all shredded and watery
it does not look like cat food it looks

to this although I don't like to chop

they get too briny so I prefer them
whole I'm gonna throw in a nice big

alright and the next ingredient will be
the reason why we don't need a ton of
mail in this because after I mix that

right and it is crazy but it totally

maybe the size of a pea and this is tuna

so that's set and it's on to the buttery

tuna melt
alright so cut it nice and thick I'm
going to throw that on a foil lined

the need to turn this over to show you
to prove I buttered both sides generous
all right very critical and then we're
just going to toast both sides under the

under the broiler two or three minutes
until it looks like that we're going to
flip it over of course we're going to
broil the other side to an equally
lovely shade of golden brown
and when both sides are toasted I want
you to find the side that's darker and
put that side down that would be the
slightly crunchy err surface so we'll
put that down with the lighter side up
and then we're going to go ahead and
take two forks and place upon the bread

something all right so make sure you're

this is very important so the edges

is placed upon the bread good and proper
we're going to go ahead and top with

Irish cheddar case you're keeping score
at home so we have our mild and melty

some subtle richness and creaminess so
on the top we're going to go with

since you've been so good we'll give it
a tiny dusting at Cayenne not only does

broils which is the last step we're
going to pop those under a hot broiler
I'm going to say about five or six
inches under the heat and we're going to
broil those for about five or six
minutes until the cheese is bubbling and
the tuna salad is heated through and if
you'll notice I have a casserole dish
underneath my sheet pan to lift it off
that middle rack a little bit so I'm a
little closer to the burner all right I
didn't want to move my rack all the way
up because it would have been too close
so you'll see there underneath I just
have a baking dish so that's a good way
to get things a little closer to your
broiler without using the highest rack
and five or six minutes later I actually
didn't time it but you'll know these
were done and picture-perfect so while I
do enjoy the classic tuna melt which is
basically a toasted cheese sandwich with
tuna in it I really like this open-faced
version if you're doing this for a group
of like six or eight people very tough
to do the classic method need like four
big pans so this is a great way to do it
for a group and then it was time to
enjoy I serve mine with a couple dill
pickles and I'd actually like
take this opportunity to apologize for
the fact there's no potato chips on this
plate that is almost a crime against
nature so when you do yours make sure
you have some chips around but
nevertheless let me eat this anyway and
that was tremendously good that buttery

from the celery onion a little brine
eNOS from the caper those chilies
warming things up and of course

just an incredible sandwich experience
